snippet: New York should create a special court for children under 18 charged with nonviolent crimes.
abstract: Editorial calls on New York State to raise age of adult criminal responsibility from 16 to 18, noting that teenagers prosecuted in adult courts are far more likely to commit violent crimes later in life; supports New York State Chief Judge Jonathan Lippman in his bid to establish special court for 16- or 17-year-olds charged with nonviolent crimes.
lead_paragraph: New York should create a special court for children under 18 charged with nonviolent crimes.

headline.main: A Court Just for Juveniles in N.Y.
headline.print_headline: In New York, juveniles need a court of their own
